textContent:
#1 What are the current factors limiting your growth and success?

#2 Write all your insecurities, dreams and goals on post-its and tag you your mirror. What do I need to remind myself to do every day to change?

#3 write down all the things you don't like to do or make you uncomfortable. Especially those things you know are good for you. And go do them. 

#4 take souls by letting the negativity from or towards others be motivation for winning their support and sponsorship through excellence. 

#5 choose any obstacle in my way or a new goal. Visualize overcoming or achieving it. What will success look and feel like. Think about it every day. Visualize the challenges that will arrive and how I will attack them. Answer the question daily - why am I doing this? What has calloused my mind? What fuels me? 

#6 take inventory of my cookie jar. Write it all out. Include obstacles overcome. Set ambitious goals and let those past victories carry me to new personal bests. It can be physical goals (i.e. personal bests) or intellectual goals (i.e. reading a # of books). If I do this right I'll get to a point where pain, boredom or self doubt kick in and I'll need to tap into my cookie jar to create the energy I need to get through. 

#7 No matter the work, running, pushups or etc get to the point where you are so tired and in pain that your mind is begging you to stop. Then push just 5-10 percent further. 

There is so much pain and suffering involved in physical challenges that it's the best training to take command of your inner dialogue, and the newfound mental strength and confidence you gain by continuing to push yourself physically will carry over to other aspects of your life. You will realize that if you were underperforming in your physical challenges, there is a good chance you are underperforming at school and work too.
title: Can't Hurt Me Notes
textContentHtml:
#1 What are the current factors limiting your growth and success?


#2 Write all your insecurities, dreams and goals on post-its and tag you your mirror. What do I need to remind myself to do every day to change?


#3 write down all the things you don't like to do or make you uncomfortable. Especially those things you know are good for you. And go do them. 


#4 take souls by letting the negativity from or towards others be motivation for winning their support and sponsorship through excellence. 


#5 choose any obstacle in my way or a new goal. Visualize overcoming or achieving it. What will success look and feel like. Think about it every day. Visualize the challenges that will arrive and how I will attack them. Answer the question daily - why am I doing this? What has calloused my mind? What fuels me? 


#6 take inventory of my cookie jar. Write it all out. Include obstacles overcome. Set ambitious goals and let those past victories carry me to new personal bests. It can be physical goals (i.e. personal bests) or intellectual goals (i.e. reading a # of books). If I do this right I'll get to a point where pain, boredom or self doubt kick in and I'll need to tap into my cookie jar to create the energy I need to get through. 


#7 No matter the work, running, pushups or etc get to the point where you are so tired and in pain that your mind is begging you to stop. Then push just 5-10 percent further. 


There is so much pain and suffering involved in physical challenges that it's the best training to take command of your inner dialogue, and the newfound mental strength and confidence you gain by continuing to push yourself physically will carry over to other aspects of your life. You will realize that if you were underperforming in your physical challenges, there is a good chance you are underperforming at school and work too.
